subject: Climate & Environment
title: Tornado Alley
description: A micro-lesson that makes Tornado Alley usable.

hook.text: A strip of the central United States gets more tornadoes than anywhere else on the planet.

buildup.text: Tornado Alley stretches from Texas to South Dakota where hot Gulf air meets cold Canadian air.

discovery.text: The flat terrain and converging air masses create perfect conditions for supercell storms.

twist.text: Tornado Alley is shifting eastward â€” into more densely populated areas â€” as the climate warms.

climax.text: The Southeast now sees more tornado fatalities than the traditional Alley.

punchline.text: The danger zone is moving. The people in its new path aren't ready.

quiz.question: Why does Tornado Alley produce so many tornadoes?
options: Hot Gulf air meets cold Canadian air over flat terrain
